summary: I wanted to watch the Captain Marvel movie a few days ago and when I’m about to reach for the nearest cinema (which is like a...
body:
I wanted to watch the Captain Marvel movie a few days ago and when I’m about to reach for the nearest cinema (which is like a few 3 blocks away from my home), turns out that they decided to close forever due to not making a contract renewal…

Now, if I want to go to the movies and watch something I have to take a bus to the next mall center. Shit! Now I feel lazy because of it but I want to see Shazam…

blog.name: crazyintheeast
blog.title: Crazy in the East
blog.description:
My current interests are :Sara Lance, Runaways(especially Karolina and Nico), Supergirl, Lena Luthor(no toxic fans are tolerated here), Pitch Perfect, The Gifted

Things I cover in general :
Jaimie Alexander(Kyle XY forever), Natalie Dormer, Person of Interest, Legends of Tommorow Wheel of Time,Happy ,Endings,Parks and Recreation,Community,Continuum
 Lost Girl, Doctor Who(especially pre Moffat),     Game  of Thrones,Buffy,Disney,Marvel, Korra, Arrow, Elementary , Once Upon a Time .Stargate , Firefly, Warehouse 13 and so on. Plus random weird and pretty stuff. 
Just a warning I post a lot and I am likely to flood your dash with stuff
.Also things I especially like are tagged "awesome". Things I find especially useful or that I would like to use or buy some day are "lifehacks".

I am bored often so feel to ask me whatever you want whenever you want. Also I do gifs sometimes. You can check them under the tag "my gifs"

tags: it's like people wer so enamored with the spinning buildings effect they built a whole poiintless movie around it
summary: The Marvel Universe would have been ten times better if we got Captain Marvel back in 2016 in place of that boring mediocre...
body: The Marvel Universe would have been ten times better if we got Captain Marvel back in 2016 in place of that boring mediocre snooze fest Doctor Strange. Watching Beneficial Cucumber run over spinning buildings bored me to tears. Literally any five minutes of Captain Marvel from start to finish are better then the entire Doctor Strange movie

blog.title: Disaster Queer Amazon

summary: carol danvers imagine where she’s into the reader big time but knows bucky likes her also, so carol steps up her game and gets...
question: carol danvers imagine where she’s into the reader big time but knows bucky likes her also, so carol steps up her game and gets the girl? loved your last piece :)
answer:
Okay, this made me hungry. So, I actually had to stop to have dinner. I am sorry if I make you hungry. So get a snack.

—–

It was lunchtime and at Avengers compound, the kitchen was full of people trying to get food made.

“Sam if you take the last slice of chicken. I am gonna stab you with this butter knife.” You weren’t joking around, and Sam knew as you took the packet of him. You had been craving a proper chicken sandwich since you finished training an hour ago.

Carol and Thor sat at the island in the middle of the room drinking coffee. Thor was mid-conversation about how he went to an all you can eat crab bar and was thrown out after eating most of the stock.

“Danvers, are you listening?”

Carol snapped back to reality and turned to Thor, who looked mildly concerned.

“Sorry I was miles away. You said you didn’t get your fill at the crab place.”

“Ah yes. I was saying …” Thor started talking about demanding a refund for the owners of the bar.

Carol was watching as you had just finished your beast of a sandwich. Taking the plate you weaved your way past a sulking Sam, who was having to eat soup now, Steve, Nat and Wanda. To get to the space next to Carol at the island.

“Hey Danvers, not hungry?” You sit down in the spare seat and tuck into your sandwich.

“Nah, coffee will state my hunger.”

Thor saw he was not wanted. So, he went to find a big bag of Doritos for his mid-day snack. Carol was only aware he left when you turned to smile at her.

“You really should it something. You want half of my sandwich?”

Slightly taken aback she sighed then picked the other half of your sandwich. You went back to eating. Carol was all too aware of the small noises emanating from you. It made her feel weak.

Seeing that you stopped to stare at Carol then the sandwich. Taking the hint she took a bite. Flavour exploded on her tongue. Carol let out a pleasing sound. This made you smile.

“This is amazing (y/n)”

“What do you expect from an amazing woman.”

The mood dropped as Bucky Barnes had made his way up to the both of you.

“Hey Bucky, you wanna bite?” You looked up at him smiling.

“Sure, why not.”

You lifted the sandwich to him, and he enveloped your hands as he bit into the sandwich. He groaned at the taste. Making you giggle and Carol seethe.

“Good or what?”

“Great. I’m about to hit town. Wanna come (y/n)?”

“Let me grab some things and I will meet you at the front.” You finished off the sandwich and jogged off to your room.

Leaving Bucky to be glared down by Carol until he took the hint to leave.

***

It was nearly 7pm by the time you got back. You were exhausted from being town and just wanted to crash on your bed.

You just had to get to the end of the hallway and then you could flop on your bed. The gym was at the start of the corridor. Not that you expected anyone to be in there, but you could hear the hard thumping of fists against the punching bag.

Not that it was your business who was letting off steam at this hour but damn you were curious. As quiet as you could be, you snuck to the doorway to the gym to see who it was.

“Carol?” You stepped into the gym. You were scared and really concerned about your friend.

She was pounding the bag with her fists brutally. She was red-faced and clearly mad at something. This called for tact.

“Carol.” You said again.

She punched the bag one more time before catching it on the backswing. She looked pissed.

“What do you want (y/n)?”

You felt your heart sink. You didn’t like seeing her like this.

“I just got back after being dragged to every boutique in town.”

“Oh, that’s just great.” On the word great she punched the bag, splitting at the seam.

“Not really. I only wanted to get a pair of new jeans, but Bucky insisted we got the best ones. Not that I needed a pair of high-end jeans. Are you okay?”

Carol dropped to the bench taking a long pull on her water bottle. Her shoulders sagged.

You crossed the room and squatted down in front of her.

“Are you okay Carol? Come on you can talk to me.”

She looked up at you her, face a mess of emotions.

“Not really.”

You sat on the floor now as your leg started to ache from the squat.

“Talk to me, Danvers.”

This made her smile.

“You really don’t take no for an answer do you (y/n)?”

“Butting in is in my nature. Now spill it.”

She was looking down at her hands and sighed.

“Are you and Barnes an item?”

There was silence. So, she looked up. You were trying not to laugh.

“I’m being serious (y/n).”

“I know but I literally had to let him down after he tried to kiss me in the parking lot of the compound.”

“Oh.” Carol was confused.

“I mean yeah he is handsome, but I have my sights set on someone else.”

“Thor? Steve? Sam?”

“No, no and no. It happens to be a woman I like.”

“Oh!” Her heart sped up a little bit.

“Yes, it’s you, you goober.”

Carol practically launched herself at you, throwing you back onto the mat, she buried her face into the crook of your neck. You could hear the faintest of ‘Suck it Bucky’ mumbled into your neck.

You pulled her close with a huge smile on your face.

If she acts like this when you tell her that you like her. Just imagine what she will do when you tell her that you love her.

—–

Prompts are open. Let me know what you think.

“Oh, that’s just great.” On the word great she punched the bag, splitting at the seam.

“Not really. I only wanted to get a pair of new jeans, but Bucky insisted we got the best ones. Not that I needed a pair of high-end jeans. Are you okay?”

Carol dropped to the bench taking a long pull on her water bottle. Her shoulders sagged.

You crossed the room and squatted down in front of her.

“Are you okay Carol? Come on you can talk to me.”

She looked up at you her, face a mess of emotions.

“Not really.”

You sat on the floor now as your leg started to ache from the squat.

“Talk to me, Danvers.”

This made her smile.

“You really don’t take no for an answer do you (y/n)?”

“Butting in is in my nature. Now spill it.”

She was looking down at her hands and sighed.

“Are you and Barnes an item?”

There was silence. So, she looked up. You were trying not to laugh.

“I’m being serious (y/n).”

“I know but I literally had to let him down after he tried to kiss me in the parking lot of the compound.”

“Oh.” Carol was confused.

“I mean yeah he is handsome, but I have my sights set on someone else.”

“Thor? Steve? Sam?”

“No, no and no. It happens to be a woman I like.”

“Oh!” Her heart sped up a little bit.

“Yes, it’s you, you goober.”

Carol practically launched herself at you, throwing you back onto the mat, she buried her face into the crook of your neck. You could hear the faintest of ‘Suck it Bucky’ mumbled into your neck.

You pulled her close with a huge smile on your face.

If she acts like this when you tell her that you like her. Just imagine what she will do when you tell her that you love her.

—–

Prompts are open. Let me know what you think.

tags: dont know if anyones mentioned this
summary: There was literally no reason for Carol to ditch the flannel. Fuck you, Fury, you think eye-patches are fashionable. As a...
body: There was literally no reason for Carol to ditch the flannel. Fuck you, Fury, you think eye-patches are fashionable. As a writer, I know that every line of a screenplay has a purpose. Even when actors improv, there’s meaning for everything. When Carol threw that lovely flannel into the car, I thought it would come up later, “Thank god I don’t have that fabric around my waist or I woulda been sucked into that turbine.” But nope. Literally never comes up. In fact, everything she does up to the point of getting a new outfit would have gone up in quality if she kept the flannel. I think the cast decided it was too much gay energy and would surpass the ‘subtext-only’ rule of the MCU.

I think the cast decided it was too much gay energy and would surpass the ‘subtext-only’ rule of the MCU.

As a writer, I know that every line of a screenplay has a purpose. Even when actors improv, there’s meaning for everything. When Carol threw that lovely flannel into the car, I thought it would come up later, “Thank god I don’t have that fabric around my waist or I woulda been sucked into that turbine.” But nope. Literally never comes up. In fact, everything she does up to the point of getting a new outfit would have gone up in quality if she kept the flannel. I think the cast decided it was too much gay energy and would surpass the ‘subtext-only’ rule of the MCU.

Even when actors improv, there’s meaning for everything. When Carol threw that lovely flannel into the car, I thought it would come up later, “Thank god I don’t have that fabric around my waist or I woulda been sucked into that turbine.” But nope. Literally never comes up. In fact, everything she does up to the point of getting a new outfit would have gone up in quality if she kept the flannel. I think the cast decided it was too much gay energy and would surpass the ‘subtext-only’ rule of the MCU.

blog.name: neven-ebrez

blog.description: Zerbe. 35. Con artist. Dreamer. You only live once. No one makes us do anything. Former meta blog turned art blog but I’ll still do analysis from time to time.

summary: I’m sure there’s like a whole ass meta thesis that can be written about modern storytelling and how they circumvent textually...
body:
I’m sure there’s like a whole ass meta thesis that can be written about modern storytelling and how they circumvent textually queer storytelling by simple making things “gay in the mirror”. I still haven’t watched the Magicians yet but they did this too before the episode that had everyone talking, yes? Lots of stories do it. Supernatural does it ad naseum. The Legend of Korra declared Korrasami canon based on its mirrored storytelling (which, intended or not, does not count). And now it seems like a popular trend to make a same sex couple raise a child together without actually “making it gay”. It seems that this is the current favored compromise of giving actual textual queer content, or at the very least (because I’ll be nice and give the benefit of the doubt here) a prelude to it. The Magicians also did this before giving actual textually queer content if I’m understanding it correctly.

Storytelling on visual mediums tends to follow in trends and this appears to be one of them. TWD is even skirting something close but it’s more Daryl telling Aaron he knew he’d be a good dad than anything explictly involving the two, though they have been through some harrowing trauma together. Does anyone know of any other examples of the “we’ll let them raise a baby together but not be gay” trend?
